The specific episode of: The Simpsons" entitled "Lisa on Ice" that aired on November 13, 1994, featuring a visual gag of text on a mobile device's screen changing from "Beat Up Martin" to "Eat Up Martha."
The existence of autocorrect as a featur: which was advertised as early as October 1993, more than a year before the episode aired.
The reference to the Apple Newton: one of the first PDAs, in the episode, highlighting the device's handwriting recognition software's flaws.
The impact of the joke in: Lisa on Ice" on Apple's software engineers, who were influenced by it while developing the autocorrect feature for the first iPhone.
